001 
002
003import java.util.StringTokenizer;
004
005/**
006 * This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. 
007 * "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
008 * 
009 * This parser reads user input and tries to interpret it as an "Adventure"
010 * command. Every time it is called it reads a line from the terminal and
011 * tries to interpret the line as a two word command. It returns the command
012 * as an object of class Command.
013 *
014 * The parser has a set of known command words. It checks user input against
015 * the known commands, and if the input is not one of the known commands, it
016 * returns a command object that is marked as an unknown command.
017 * 
018 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau
019 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2013.09.15
020 */
021public class Parser 
022{  
023    private CommandWords aValidCommands;  // (voir la classe CommandWords)
024    private GameEngine aGameEngine;
025    private Player aPlayer;
026
027    /**
028 * Default constructor that initializes the valid commands and input reader.
029 */
030    public Parser(final GameEngine pGameEngine) 
031    {
032        this.aValidCommands = new CommandWords();
033        this.aGameEngine = pGameEngine;
034    } // Parser()
035    /**
036 * Returns a list of valid command words.
037 */
038    
039    public String getCommands() {
040        return this.aValidCommands.getCommandList();
041    }
042
043   /**
044 * Reads user input and returns the next command.
045 */
046 public Command getCommand( final String pInputLine) 
047    {
048        String vWord1;
049        StringBuilder vWord2 = new StringBuilder();
050
051        StringTokenizer tokenizer = new StringTokenizer( pInputLine );
052
053        if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
054            vWord1 = tokenizer.nextToken();      // get first word
055        else
056            vWord1 = null;
057        
058            if (vWord1 != null) {
059            
060          
061              
062        if (vWord1.equals("back") || vWord1.equals("look")) {
063    
064             while(tokenizer.hasMoreTokens()) {
065            vWord2.append(tokenizer.nextToken()).append(" ");
066        }
067    }
068         else {
069            if ( tokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
070                vWord2.append(tokenizer.nextToken()); 
071        }
072        }
073       
074            
075        if (vWord1.toLowerCase().equals("yes") && this.aGameEngine.getRestartGame())
076            vWord2.append(vWord1.toLowerCase());
077       
078        else if (vWord2.length() == 0)
079            vWord2 = null;
080        
081
082        // note: we just ignore the rest of the input line.
083
084        // Now check whether this word is known. If so, create a command
085        // with it. If not, create a "null" command (for unknown command).
086
087        return new Command( this.aValidCommands.getCommandWord(vWord1) == null ? CommandWord.UNKNOWN : this.aValidCommands.getCommandWord(vWord1), vWord2 != null ? vWord2.toString() : null);
088      
089    } // getCommand(.)
090    
091} // Parser
